sections.body: This Act may be called the Pakistan Citizenship Act, 1951. It shall come into force at once.

In this Act 'alien' means a person who is not a citizen of Pakistan or a Commonwealth citizen; 'Indo-Pakistan sub-continent' means India as defined in the Government of India Act, 1935; 'minor' means any person who has not completed the age of twenty-one years; 'prescribed' means prescribed by rules made under this Act.

sections.section_title: Citizenship at the date of commencement of this Act
sections.body: At the commencement of this Act, every person shall be deemed to be a citizen of Pakistan who or any of whose parents or grandparents was born in the territory now included in Pakistan and who after the fourteenth day of August, 1947, has not been permanently resident in any country outside Pakistan.
Every person born in Pakistan after the commencement of this Act shall be a citizen of Pakistan by birth.
A person born after the commencement of this Act shall be a citizen of Pakistan by descent if his parent is a citizen of Pakistan at the time of his birth.

The Federal Government may, upon his obtaining a certificate of domicile under this Act, register as a citizen of Pakistan by migration any person who has migrated to the territories now included in Pakistan from any territory in the Indo-Pakistan sub-continent.

sections.section_title: Persons migrating from the territories of Pakistan
sections.body: A person who has after the first day of March, 1947, migrated from the territories now included in Pakistan to the territories now included in India shall not be a citizen of Pakistan.

sections.section_title: Rights of citizenship of certain persons resident abroad
sections.body: The Federal Government may, upon application made to it, register as a citizen of Pakistan any person who, or whose father or whose fatherâ€™s father, was born in the Indo-Pakistan sub-continent and who is ordinarily resident in a country outside Pakistan.
The Federal Government may, upon an application made to it, register that person as a citizen of Pakistan by naturalization.

Any woman who by reason of her marriage to a British subject before the first day of January, 1949, has acquired the status of a British subject shall, if her husband becomes a citizen of Pakistan, be a citizen of Pakistan.
The Federal Government may, upon application made in the prescribed manner by a parent or guardian of a minor child of a citizen of Pakistan, register the child as a citizen of Pakistan.

sections.section_title: Citizenship by registration to begin on date of registration
sections.body: Any person registered as a citizen of Pakistan shall be such a citizen from the date of his registration.
If any territory becomes a part of Pakistan the President may, by order, specify the persons who shall be citizens of Pakistan by reason of their connection with that territory.

sections.section_title: Dual citizenship or nationality not permitted
sections.body: Dual citizenship or nationality is not permitted.
